repo_notes.content: Reinhardt is a polylithic batteries-included Rust web framework inspired by Django, Django REST Framework, and FastAPI. The framework is organized as a Cargo workspace with 70+ crates, allowing users to select only the components they need via feature flags.
repo_notes.author: Maintainer

repo_notes.content: Key architectural layers: 1) Foundation (reinhardt-core, reinhardt-http, reinhardt-server), 2) Data Layer (reinhardt-db with ORM and migrations), 3) REST Framework (reinhardt-rest, reinhardt-views), 4) Authentication (reinhardt-auth with JWT/OAuth/Session), 5) Advanced Features (GraphQL, WebSockets, Admin, Tasks).
repo_notes.author: Architect

repo_notes.content: The crates/ directory contains all workspace members. The examples/local/ directory contains 7 example projects demonstrating real-world usage. The docs/ directory contains comprehensive documentation including tutorials, API references, and coding standards.
repo_notes.author: Maintainer

repo_notes.content: Feature flag system: 'minimal' for microservices (~5-10MB), 'standard' for typical web apps (~20-30MB), 'full' for all features (~50+MB). Individual features can be toggled granularly (e.g., db-postgres, auth-jwt, middleware-cors).
repo_notes.author: Architect

pages.title: Architecture Overview
pages.purpose: Explain the polylithic architecture philosophy, how crates are organized in layers (Foundation, Data, REST, Auth, Advanced), and the request/response flow through the framework.

pages.title: Core Foundation
pages.purpose: Document reinhardt-core (types, exceptions, validators, signals), reinhardt-http (request/response types), reinhardt-server (Hyper-based server), and reinhardt-macros.

pages.title: Dependency Injection
pages.purpose: Document reinhardt-di: FastAPI-inspired type-safe async DI system with scoped/singleton support, injectable types, and integration with request handlers.

pages.title: URL Routing
pages.purpose: Document reinhardt-urls: URL pattern matching, path converters, route registration, and how routing integrates with the middleware pipeline.

pages.title: Database Layer
pages.purpose: Document reinhardt-db: ORM with Model definitions, QuerySet API (filter, exclude, annotate, aggregate), migrations system, relationships (ForeignKey, ManyToMany), and supported backends (PostgreSQL, MySQL, SQLite, CockroachDB).

pages.title: REST Framework
pages.purpose: Document reinhardt-rest: Serializers, Parsers (JSON, Form, Multipart), ViewSets, Routers, pagination, filtering, and OpenAPI generation.

pages.title: Class-Based Views
pages.purpose: Document reinhardt-views: Generic views (ListView, DetailView, CreateView, UpdateView, DeleteView), mixins, and how they integrate with the REST framework.

pages.title: Authentication System
pages.purpose: Document reinhardt-auth: Authentication backends (JWT, Token, Session, OAuth2, Basic), permission system (DjangoModelPermissions, object-level), user/group management.

pages.title: Middleware
pages.purpose: Document reinhardt-middleware: 20+ middleware including CORS, CSRF, CSP, compression, caching, logging, tracing, rate limiting, and session management.

pages.title: Forms
pages.purpose: Document reinhardt-forms: Django-style form processing with 20+ field types, validation, ModelForms, FormSets, and FormWizards.

pages.title: Frontend Framework
pages.purpose: Document reinhardt-pages: WASM-based frontend with fine-grained reactivity, SSR, hydration, and JSX-like macros (page!, head!).

pages.title: Real-time Features
pages.purpose: Document reinhardt-websockets (room-based messaging, auth, rate limiting) and reinhardt-graphql (async-graphql integration, subscriptions, DI support).

pages.title: Background Tasks
pages.purpose: Document reinhardt-tasks: Celery-inspired task queue with scheduling, retries, DAG execution, worker load balancing, and integration with the framework.

pages.title: Admin Panel
pages.purpose: Document reinhardt-admin: Admin interface generation, model registration, custom admin views, and reinhardt-admin-cli.

pages.title: Utilities
pages.purpose: Document reinhardt-utils (timezone, caching, storage, static files), reinhardt-i18n (internationalization), reinhardt-mail (email backends).

pages.title: Feature Flags Guide
pages.purpose: Explain the three-level feature hierarchy (minimal/standard/full), module-level features, database backends, auth variants, and how to optimize binary size.

pages.title: Example Projects
pages.purpose: Document the 7 example projects in examples/local/: hello-world, rest-api, database-integration, tutorial-basis, tutorial-rest, twitter, github-issues.

pages.title: Testing Guide
pages.purpose: Document reinhardt-test: TestContainers integration, test fixtures, and testing best practices for Reinhardt applications.
